qas.question: How many voters are needed to put a constitutional amendment to a national vote?
How long do citizens have to collect enough votes for a national vote on a constitutional amendment?
What can Parliament supplement the amendment proposed by the citizens with?
What must voters do on the ballot when Parliament adds a supplement?
How much of the national popular vote and the cantonal popular vote is needed to pass a constitutional amendment?

context: Similarly, the federal constitutional initiative allows citizens to put a constitutional amendment to a national vote, if <a0_0>100,000<a0_0/> voters sign the proposed amendment within <a1_0>18 months<a1_0/>.[note 8] Parliament can supplement the proposed amendment with <a2_0>a counter-proposal<a2_0/>, and then voters must <a3_0>indicate a preference<a3_0/> on the ballot in case both proposals are accepted. Constitutional amendments, whether introduced by initiative or in Parliament, must be accepted by <a4_0>a double majority<a4_0/> of the national popular vote and the cantonal popular votes.[note 9]
